titles.title: Gädlä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qәddus "Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qәddus" / Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus"

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Vita of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qәddus" (fols. 3ra-127va) II) Täʾamrä Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus "Miracles of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qǝddus": 13 miracles (fols. 127vb-162va)
Additiones 1-4.

donors.donor: The name of the original donor has been erased throughout Texts II and III and replaced with Gäbrä ʾArägawi (e.g., fols. 4vb, 21v, 127ra, 128, 132vb, 145ra; see also Additio 1). Several other names were added later into supplication formulas of Texts II and III: his father Mäzgäbä Śǝllase (e.g., fols. 4vb, 128ra, 130vb, 141va; see also Additio 1), Wälättä Krǝstos (e.g., fols. 130vb, 153ra; s. also Additio 1), ʿAmdä Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 127vb, 137ra, 142ra), Gäbrä Maryam (e.g., fols. 127ra, 142ra), Täsfa Mikaʾel (e.g., fols. 130vb, 141ra), Täsfa Ṣǝyon (e.g., fols. 128ra, 142ra), Wälättä Maryam (fol. 134va), ʾAmätä Maryam (fol. 134va), Wälättä Kidan (fol. 137ra).

txstates.txstate: Holes and tears carefully amended on fols. 37, 100, 164.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 5 tools were used: fourfold line fillet, triple circle, chain, wave form, waffels).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – I(8/fols. 3r-12v) – II(10; s.l.: 4, stub after 6; 7, stub after 3/fols. 11r-20v) – III(10/fols. 21r-30v) – IV(10/fols. 31r-40v) – V(10/fols. 41r-50v) – VI(10/fols. 51r-60v) – VII(10/fols. 61r-70v) – VIII(10/fols. 71r-80v) – IX(10/fols. 81r-90v) – X(10; s.l.: 3, stub after 7; 8, stub after 2/fols. 91r-100v) – XI(10/fols. 101r-110v) – XII(10/fols. 111r-120v) – XIII(10/fols. 121r-130v) – XIV(10/fols. 131r-140v) – XV(12; s.l.: 3, stub after 10; 10, stub after 3/fols. 141r-152v) – XVI(12; s.l.: 4, stub after 8; 9, stub after 3/fols. 153r-164v).

taunit.rl-info: Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/J. (On some fols. 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/G). Primary pricks are partly visible. Ruling pricks are partly visible. Structural pricks are partly visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. Fols. 23 and 28 have additional horizontal and vertical lines in the upper and outer margins.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Finely shaped, slender, tall, upright letters. Distinctive features: - the vowel marker of ጵ is attached to the left side of the stroke - ፩ is triangular upwards-oriented - ፮ looks like "compressed" numeral "seven".

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the protagonist; a few lines on the incipit page of Text II; incipit of Text III; incipits of miracles and their numbers; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Omitted letters are written interlineally in red (e.g., fols. 39vb, 46rb, 50vb, 51rb, 55rb, 68rab, 69vb, 71ra).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡ (in Text I: e.g., fols. 1rb, 1vb)

otherdetails.otherdetail: Miracles of Text II are only partly numbered.

additional.cont: Fols. 1ra-2ra: Mälkəˀa Gäbrä Mänfäs Qəddus "Image of Gäbrä Mänfäs Qəddus", incomplete.
additional.det: Crudely written in poor hand; the letters are very irregular and angular in shape.

Gäbrä ʾArägawi is mentioned as the purchaser and donor. Other persons mentioned are his father Mäzgäbä Śǝllase and a certain Wälättä Krǝstos. The note is crudely written in strong amaranth over another, erased note in black (in which the names partly remained). The handwriting is similar but not identical to the hand of GMG-017.

additional.cont: Fol. 162vb: Record concerning the commemoration days of the donor's family members (?).
additional.det: ʿAmdä Mikaʾel died on 22th Däqsyos (= Taḫśaś). The donor's (?) father died on 5th Yäkkatit and the mother on 8th Mizya[sic].

additional.cont: Fols. 163rb-164rb: Genealogy (from Žämäl to Wǝddase Maryam [n.l.] Täklat).
additional.det: The genealogy is written in Amharic and Gәʿәz.

extras.extra: - Corrections written over erased words and passages, in different hands: e.g., fols. 6vb, 8va, 9rb, 14ra, 22va, 67rb, 69ra, 71ra, 130ra. - Erased notes: fols. 5v, 6r, 7v, 10r, 13v, 17v, 32r, 34r, 96r, 97v, 100ra, 101v, 102r, 105v, 107v, 131v, 132r, 153v, 154rv. - Short supplications for donor Gäbrä ʾArägawi, written interlineally in strong amaranth: fols. 35vb, 42ra, 73ra, 83vb. - Pen trial: fols. 1r, 2r, 164v. - Crude notes, in pen: fols. 1rv, 2rv, 105v, 164v.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid:
- Names of the months indicating the readings are written in the upper margin of some fols.; Text II (with marks in the midst of the text indicating the beginnings): ምንባብ፡ ዘመስከረም: fol. 3ra ዘጥቅምት: fol. 10vb ዘኅዳር: fol. 16vb ዘታኅሳስ[sic]: fol. 27va ዘጥር: fol. 35vb ዘያካቲት[sic]: fol. 42ra ምንባብ፡ ዘመጋቢት: fol. 58ra ምንባብ፡ ዘሚያዝያ: fol. 73ra ዘግንቦት: fol. 83vb ዘሰኔ: fol. 96ra [ዘሐምሌ: fol. 105va, erased] ዘነሐሴ: fol. 117ra.
Text III: ዘመስከረም: fol. 128ra ዘጥቅምት: fol. 130vb ዘሕዳር[sic]: fol. 133ra ዘታኅሣሥ: fol. 134va ዘጥር: fol. 137ra ዘየካቲት: fol. 141rb ዘመጋቢት: fol. 142ra ዘማዝያ[sic]: fol. 145ra ዘግንቦት: fol. 149ra ዘሰኔ: fol. 153ra ዘሐምሌ: fol. 155ra ዘነሐሴ: fol. 156ra.

frames.frame: - Fol. 162va (explicit page of Text III): short coloured (red and black) ornamental band; geometric motifs.
